title: Pietralta 2016  Chianti
description: Underbrush, dark fruit and baking spice aromas lead the nose of this wine. The straightforward palate delivers red cherry, clove and orange peel hints alongside round tannins. Drink soon.

title: Pighin 2016 Pinot Grigio (Collio)
description: This wine's subdued exotic fruit and acacia flower aromas lift out of the glass. The rounded, fruity palate offers mature pear and ripe honeydew melon flavors while a banana note marks the close.

title: Rabble 2017 Mossfire Ranch Rosé (Paso Robles)
description: Red-cherry-candy aromas meet with rose petals and beach sand on the nose of this pink wine. There is decent grip to the sip, where red-apple and red-pear flavors arise.

title: Raphael 2016 First Label Sauvignon Blanc (North Fork of Long Island)
description: Notes of pollen, lemon and fresh flowers carry the quiet nose. Light in body and brisk in feel, green melon and grapefruit flavors drift to an astringent, salty finish.

title: Rhône to the Bone 2017 Rosé (Côtes du Rhône)
description: This wine's initial flinty aromas linger a bit before introducing crisp red berry and cherry notes. It's delicately concentrated but refreshingly spry, with lingering salt and sea breeze notes.

title: Riebeek Cellars 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Swartland)
description: Soft scents of baby's breath, lemongrass and minty herbs dance on the nose of this delicate white, with hints of lemon-lime citrus at the core. It's lightweight and direct in feel, with clean acidity and a slightly pithy citrus character on the close. Enjoy this dainty gem now.

title: Rocca di Castagnoli 2016 Fattoria di Scannano  (Chianti)
description: Subdued blue flower and baking spice aromas lead the nose of this blend of 90% Sangiovese and 10% Ciliegiolo. The straightforward palate delivers black cherry fruit accented with black pepper and licorice notes alongside relaxed tannins. Drink soon.

title: Rooster Hill 2016 Chardonnay (Finger Lakes)
description: There's a wealth of rind aromas in this wine, beckoning lemon, pineapple and papaya skin tones. A rounded palate is supported by a broad melon flavor, with a mild citrus vein offering focus.

title: Rosemont NV White (Virginia)
description: While the aromas and flavors are very faint, there is a complexity imparted by lees. Lemon and orange peel are met with notes of pilsner and mealy apple. Texturally, this is really nice—creamy and sprightly all at once. The finish is long and leesy.

title: San Lorenzo Vini 2016 Rosato (Colli Aprutini)
description: This easy-drinking fifty-fifty blend of Montepulciano and Cabernet Sauvignon has inviting red berry, blue flower and baking spice aromas. It's bright and savory, with red currant, pomegranate and white pepper flavors punctuated by fresh acidity.

title: Seven Peaks 2014 Red (California)
description: This is a well-balanced medium-bodied non-oaky wine that blends a fresh fruitiness like black cherries with a lightly tannic texture.

title: Shadybrook 2015 Platiné Blanc Semillon-Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)
description: This combines 65% Sémillon and 35% Sauvignon Blanc into a fleshy floral expression of textured green apple and melon that's considerably weighty in body and ripeness.

title: St. Francis 2015 Old Vines Zinfandel (Sonoma County)
description: Reduced on the nose, this tannic wine is tautly wound in oak, its concentrated full-bodied flavors ripe and fleshy in blackberry jam and vanilla.

title: Stone Tower 2016 Reserve Sauvignon Blanc (Virginia)
description: This reserve Sauvignon Blanc is teeming with scents of candied peach and lemon, with geranium and honeydew. Full in body, this is a white that could stand up to a heartier meal. The creaminess and roundness stick around on the long finish.

title: The Winery SF 2013 Zinfandel (North Coast)
description: On the lighter side, this wine is very smooth and flavorful, not very tannic, and easy to drink. It blends good cherry and plum notes with some savory, black-pepper complexity.

title: Uggiano 2016 Prestige  (Chianti Colli Fiorentini)
description: This opens with baking spice and dark-skinned berry aromas. The straightforward palate offers fleshy Morello cherry, white pepper and clove hints alongside smooth tannins. Drink soon.

title: Vecchia Cantina di Montepulciano 2016 Poggio Stella  (Chianti)
description: Subtle red-skinned fruit and underbrush aromas lead the nose of this easygoing wine. The simple palate offers sour cherry and star anise hints alongside smooth tannins. Drink soon.

title: Vie Winery 2013 L'Intruse Mourvèdre (Central Coast)
description: This bottling appears extremely extracted, starting with concentrated aromas of dried berry, red plums and stewed red fruits, along with a tang of balsamic. There is peppery spice to the sip, where the mouthfeel is thick and the flavors are overly rich, although cut by an acidity that simmers long into the leathery finish.

title: Vie Winery 2013 Thompson Vineyard Syrah (Santa Barbara County)
description: Concentrated aromas of sweet blackberry syrup and lilacs feel overripe. It's thick and stiff on the palate, with likable dark fruits and cola spice.

title: Wölffer 2017 Summer in a Bottle Rosé (Long Island)
description: An interesting blend of 51% Merlot and 23% Chardonnay, with the remainder Cabernet Franc, Cabernet Sauvignon and Riesling, this rosé is tight and crisp in feel, with tart red berries taking center stage over softer flavors of peach and apricot. The palate is light in feel, with an ever-present vein of acidity keeping focus.

title: Andeluna 2017 Filosur Cabernet Sauvignon (Mendoza)
description: Leafy red-fruit aromas are a touch rough and show a hint of acetone. This is pulpy and saturated on the palate, with jammy weight. Berry flavors are loud and spicy, with mild bitterness extending onto a peppery finish.

title: Candoni 2016  Chianti
description: Red fruit and tilled soil aromas lead the nose of this wine while the simple, light-bodied palate offers red plum and white pepper hints. It's easy-drinking, with soft tannins. Drink soon.

title: Castel di Pugna 2016  Chianti Colli Senesi
description: Earthy aromas of dark fruit and tilled soil lead the nose of this wine. The simple palate offers black plum and clove flavors. It's easygoing and accessible, with flexible tannins. Drink soon.

title: Chakana 2016 Nuna Bonarda (Luján de Cuyo)
description: Rubbery black-fruit aromas come with a note of hot blacktop. A flush palate with fruit-based weight is tight and tannic, while flavors of salty berry fruits and black plum are rugged. A savory, roasted finish with a mint note is tannic and clampy.

title: Château Beaulieu 2017 Rosé (Coteaux d'Aix-en-Provence)
description: This soft wine is ripe, juicy and only lightly textured. Spice and pepper in profusion season the red-berry fruits. Acidity adds contrast and a crisp aftertaste.

title: Château de Birot 2017  Bordeaux Blanc
description: Full, ripe and fruity, this is a rounded wine from the Cadillac estate. Packed with apple, lemon and spice flavors, it is mouth-filling, rich and ready to drink.

title: Château Haut Pougnan 2017  Bordeaux Blanc
description: A ripe wine, this has rich apricot and pear flavors. Acidity adds a fresh bite and gives the wine an extra depth of flavor. Drink now.

title: Château Pas du Cerf 2017 Le Merle Rosé (Côtes de Provence)
description: Le Merle (meaning the robin) is the entry-level wine from this beautiful estate with its backdrop of wooded hills. It is a warm wine with caramel and red fruits comfortably mingling together. The wine is delicious, crisp and ready to drink.

title: Der Pollerhof 2017 Apoll White (Weinland Österreich)
description: This easygoing blend has a rather earthy nose suggesting almost overripe pear fruit. The palate is pliable, soft, fruity and fresh: an easy summery Austrian white with a dry finish.
